wikipedia_page.main: John Linden Merriman (27 June 1936 – 30 September 1999) was a British long-distance runner. He competed in the men's 10,000 metres at the 1960 Summer Olympics.

link_mentions.page: Athletics at the 1962 British Empire and Commonwealth Games – Men's 6 miles
response: The event was won by the 19-year-old Canadian Bruce Kidd finishing 100 yards ahead the defending champion, Australian Dave Power and Welshmen John Merriman. Kidd crossed the line in 28:26.6 breaking the Commonwealth Games record set by Power in Cardiff by 21.2 seconds. Such was the pace of the race that the top six place getters finished inside the Games record time.
